result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan Gerald Poulakos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Conspiracy to Commit Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Conspiracy], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Restitution in amount of $3,205.60 payable to TCF Bank, and $1,093.07 payable to Johnson Bank-first priority.
All costs, fees and surcharges including DNA.  All applicable fees of supervision.
If revoked, all to be paid through collectin by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with the victims named in the complaint.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathan Gerald Poulakos in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Nathan Gerald Poulakos in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 95 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS..

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 95 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.

Court STAYED the sentence in Counts 1 & 2 and placed the defendant on 4 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 4 MONTHS condition time at the day reporting center.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with the victims named in the complaint.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $3,205.60 payable to TCF Bank and $1,093.07 payable to Johnson Bank- FIRST PRIORITY; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

As to both Counts 1 and 2 and specified in the amended information: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.

Defendant Nathan Gerald Poulakos in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Nathan Gerald Poulakos in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 1 amended to Conspiracy to Commit Forgery-Uttering , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 943.38(2), 939.31, and 939.50(3)(h) a Class H Felony. Also, Court ordered Count 2 amended to Bail Jumping (Felony) , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 946.49(1)(b) and 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Nathan Gerald Poulakos not in court, in custody. David Robles appeared via phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nathan Gerald Poulakos in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Nathan Gerald Poulakos in custody.  Ron Dague for David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision with same conditions as ordered on 14CM5037 as follows:

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

*no written order*

Defendant Nathan Gerald Poulakos in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Nathan Gerald Poulakos in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  The Court orders KEEP SEPARATE from Bradley T. Wallace (dob 5-03-81).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Nathan Gerald Poulakos
Current: 3660 S 21st St, Milwaukee, WI 53221 United States  (Effective: 03-29-2015)
Prior: 1251 North 116th Street, Wauwatosa, WI 53226
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
